snippet.title: Man charged after allegedly stealing a safe from Rozelle pub
snippet.content: Photo: NSW Police Force A man spotted allegedly wheeling a large floor safe in a shopping trolley down a busy road in Sydney's inner west will face court on Wednesday morning charged over a pub robbery. Police allege the 44-year-old man broke into Rozelle hotel early on Tuesday morning, taking cash, documents and a heavy floor safe. The man was arrested at 10.15am the same day while allegedly wheeling the safe, estimated to weigh a few hundred kilograms, in a shopping trolley along Victoria Road. Police could not say how the man allegedly managed to get the safe into the trolley before making his getaway. He was taken to Newtown Police Station where he was charged with a number of offences including break, enter and steal. Following further investigation, he was also charged with breaking into the same hotel in June and allegedly stealing keys, a computer and a cash register. The man was refused police bail and is scheduled to appear in Parramatta Local Court on Wednesday.
